questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS is Cascading Style Sheets, used to style HTML elements.

questions.question: Which property changes text color?
questions.explanation: The color property sets text color in CSS.

questions.question: Which property sets background color?
questions.explanation: background-color sets the background color of elements.

questions.question: How do you select an element with id='header'?
questions.explanation: The # symbol selects elements by their id attribute.

questions.question: How do you select elements with class='button'?
questions.explanation: The dot . selects elements by their class attribute.

questions.question: Which property controls text size?
questions.explanation: font-size controls the size of text.

questions.question: Which layout model uses rows and columns?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid creates two-dimensional layouts with rows and columns.

questions.question: What property adds space inside an element's border?
questions.explanation: Padding creates space between content and border.
